text: Oh my god. I finally sent my revised paper to my advisor. It is probably going to come back for more work but having it off my desk is very well for me. I hadn’t wake up without a terrible worry for months. This paper has become an huge emotional burden for me (it is the first one). At times the only thing I want is to not see it anymore ever.

elements.text: Oh my god. I finally sent my revised paper to my advisor. It is probably going to come back for more work but having it off my desk is very well for me. I hadn’t wake up without a terrible worry for months. This paper has become an huge emotional burden for me (it is the first one). At times the only thing I want is to not see it anymore ever.

text: If it's any help, it's a bit of roller coaster ride between this step, making the paper public, sending it our for review, etc. Prepare for the ups and downs. The good news is that it eventually does end :slightly_smiling_face:.

elements.text: If it's any help, it's a bit of roller coaster ride between this step, making the paper public, sending it our for review, etc. Prepare for the ups and downs. The good news is that it eventually does end

text: Good luck <@UEGRU91B2>. That's an understandable feeling.

Yes, I am already familiar with the roller coaster, it got two revisions before being angrily rejected by an infamous researcher, then in the new journal it got some extra revisions that have extended for a year. Lately I ave been feeling that I am not working for interest or curiosity, but to satisfy these reviewers. I am starting my third year working on it.

elements.text: Yes, I am already familiar with the roller coaster, it got two revisions before being angrily rejected by an infamous researcher, then in the new journal it got some extra revisions that have extended for a year. Lately I ave been feeling that I am not working for interest or curiosity, but to satisfy these reviewers. I am starting my third year working on it.

text: Feel this 100%. I also lost interest in a particular project going through the same roller coaster. The good news is now that it’s been published a while, I still look at that work and think about the cool extensions I could make to it if I had the time. Like folks have already said, it does eventually end, on the up side people will get to see your work once it is published, and the curiosity comes back.

text: Good luck! Publishing is one of those things that burns people out of academia. And I really envy people that are so good at it!

elements.text: Good luck! Publishing is one of those things that burns people out of academia. And I really envy people that are so good at it!

text: Definitely relatable. I feel like it gets better though eventually. Like, the more papers you have at various stages of the process, the less the hassle with any one matters. Also, preprints are great.

elements.text: Definitely relatable. I feel like it gets better though eventually. Like, the more papers you have at various stages of the process, the less the hassle with any one matters. Also, preprints are great.

text: So relatable. I can barely read my first paper because of the stress it brings back. The recent ones are easy and fun, so theres something to look forward to at least!
